definition: to make a copy/to reproduce/to remake (a movie)
system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]

sentences.english: You like Chinese films in their original undubbed versions.
sentences.chinese: 你更喜欢没有被重制的中国老电影。

sentences.english: I was jazzed to see the remake, as I'm a huge fan of the original.
sentences.chinese: 我急切地想看这部重制，因为我是原版的忠实粉丝。

sentences.english: Thanks to disciple Chang Wang for rearranging the calligraphy and adding the seal.
sentences.chinese: 谢谢弟子昌旺将此翰墨及印文重制。

sentences.english: What do you all think of this potential re-imagining of Jack the Ripper?
sentences.chinese: 你们对这个对开膛手杰克形象的重制有什么看法？

sentences.english: It seems like some of them are remakes, such as Star Fox.
sentences.chinese: 看起来好像有一些是重制的，像是《星际火狐》？

sentences.english: The principle of structure formation in processed cheese in fully explained.
sentences.chinese: 阐述了重制干酪结构形成的原理。

sentences.english: I'm not sure I could recreate Oblivion.
sentences.chinese: 我并没有把握能重制《湮没》。

definition: Rockman or Mega Man (video game series)
to stir-fry leftover rice/fig. to rehash the same story/to serve up the same old product
to reproduce photographically/to duplicate/to adapt (as a movie)/to remake (a movie)/adaptation/reproduction/remake
to revise the current edition/revised edition
